snippet.title: An interview with New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio
snippet.description: Short summary of Last Wednesday afternoon, I interviewed New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio in his office at New York's City Hall. Here is a transcript of the interview, which is the basis of my Monday column on de Blasio and the city.

snippet.title: Chinese police begin carrying guns during patrols
snippet.description: A quarter of the police in Shanghai began carrying guns during routine patrols for the first time this week as part of a China-wide boost in police firepower following a deadly mass knifing blamed on Xinjiang separatists.

snippet.title: Morning Plum: Pressure on Obama to "go big" on deportations
snippet.description: The AFL-CIO issues a new memo arguing that executive action on deportations would be on solid legal ground.

snippet.title: Wonkbook: 8 million is not the only Obamacare number that counts
snippet.description: Here's why Obamacare is not just one number.

snippet.title: Read In: Monday, April 21, 2014
snippet.description: Prepping for Asia, Dems lead fundraising chase, Kingston whacked by old Bachmann PAC, and Sen. Blumenthal's close call with Metro-North

snippet.title: 13 questions with Boston Mayor Marty Walsh
snippet.description: Boston's new mayor sits down to talk the marathon, Elizabeth Warren, Joe Biden, and his first 100 days

snippet.title: Pujols powering toward 500th homer
snippet.description: Albert Pujols is closing in on his 500th homer and joining a prestigious club. More important for the Los Angeles Angels, he's looking like his powerful self again.

snippet.title: Popovich to Sager: 'I promise I'll be nice'
snippet.description: Spurs coach Gregg Popovich says he looks forward to sideline reporter Craig Sager's return and "I promise I'll be nice."

snippet.title: Craig Sager gets touching tribute from Gregg Popovich
snippet.description: TNT reporter, who has had a number of memorable interviews with Spurs coach, will miss NBA playoffs while he has treatment for leukemia.

snippet.title: Fracking foes cringe as unions back drilling boom
snippet.description: After early complaints that out-of-state firms got the most jobs, some local construction trade workers and union members in Pennsylvania, Ohio and West Virginia say they're now benefiting in a big way from the Marcellus and Utica Shale oil and gas boom.
